spanishExample: Debe saber que lo que dice del mundo no tiene nada que ver con eso.
englishTranslation: He must know that what he says about the world doesn’t have anything to do with that.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
"que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
debe: must, he/she/it must (Deber, present, 3rd person)
del: "of the" before a masculine noun
tener que ver: have to do (with) (idiom)

spanishExample: Debemos hacer muchas cosas por la tierra.
englishTranslation: We must do a lot of things for the earth.
vocabIncluded: debemos:must, we must (Deber, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Deben ir a la ciudad y después venir acá.
englishTranslation: They must go to the city and then come here.
vocabIncluded: deben: must, they must (Deber, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Deberá hacer eso.
englishTranslation: He will have to(Deber future) do that.
vocabIncluded: deberá: will have to/must, he/she/it will have to/must (Deber, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Deberás hablar con ellos.
englishTranslation: You will have to(Deber) talk to them.
vocabIncluded: deberás: will have to/must, you will will have to/must (Deber, future, 2nd person)
hablar: to speak / to talk (Hablar infinitive)

spanishExample: Debería ir por esa calle si quiero estar ahí a tiempo.
englishTranslation: I should go along that street if I want to be there on time.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener

spanishExample: Deberíamos hablar con ella.
englishTranslation: We should talk to her.
vocabIncluded: deberíamos: should, we should (Deber, conditional, 1st person plural)
hablar: to speak / to talk (Hablar infinitive)

spanishExample: Deberían estar fuera de la casa, cerca de la puerta de atrás.
englishTranslation: They should be outside the house, near the back door.
vocabIncluded: cerca: near (adverb often used with de)
deberían: should, they should (Deber, conditional, 3rd person plural)
fuera: out/outside (adverb often used with de)

spanishExample: Debes ir para allá, donde está el hospital.
englishTranslation: You must go over there, where the hospital is.
vocabIncluded: debes: must, you must (Deber, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Debí estar por allí, dentro del lugar.
englishTranslation: I had to(Deber preterite) be over there, inside the place.
vocabIncluded: debí: had to/must have, I  had to/must have (Deber, preterite, 1st person)
del: "of the" before a masculine noun
dentro: inside (adverb often used with de)

spanishExample: Debía ir a ese país todo el tiempo porque mi familia estaba ahí.
englishTranslation: I had to(Deber imperfect) go to that country all the time because my family was there.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
debía: had to/must have, I had to/must have (Deber, imperfect, 1st person)

spanishExample: Debíamos hacer eso todo el tiempo antes.
englishTranslation: We had to(Deber imperfect) do that all the time before.
vocabIncluded: debíamos: had to/must have, we had to/must have (Deber, imperfect, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Debías estar en el pueblo antes y ahora yo debo hacerlo.
englishTranslation: You had to(Deber, imperfect) be in the town before and now I must do it.
vocabIncluded: debo: must, I must (Deber, present, 1st person)
debías: had to/must have, you had to/must have (Deber, imperfect, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Debimos estar afuera.
englishTranslation: We had to(Deber preterite) be outside.
vocabIncluded: debimos: had to/must have, we had to/must have (Deber, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Debió ir con ellos y yo debería hacer lo mismo.
englishTranslation: She had (Deber preterite) to go with them and I should do the same.
vocabIncluded: "lo": "the" with no noun, as in "lo bueno"
debió: had to/must have, he/she/it had to/must have (Deber, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: El pueblo no lo hará contigo, debiste estar ahí.
englishTranslation: The people won’t do it with you, you had to(Deber preterite) be there.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
debiste: had to/must have, you had to/must have (Deber, preterite, 2nd person)
hará: "will do/make", "he/she/it will do/make" (Hacer, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Estábamos cerca del lugar al que ya fuiste.
englishTranslation: We were near the place to which you already went.
vocabIncluded: "el que" to mean "which" after a preposition
al: "to the" before a masculine noun
cerca: near (adverb often used with de)
del: "of the" before a masculine noun
ya: adverb meaning "anymore", "already", and a variety of other time-related things

spanishExample: Están allá, por ese lado de la ciudad.
englishTranslation: They are yonder, around that side of the city.

spanishExample: Esto es lo que yo debía hacer en la escuela cuando era niño.
englishTranslation: This is what I had to(Deber imperfect) do at school when I was a kid.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
debía: had to/must have, I had to/must have (Deber, imperfect, 1st person)

spanishExample: Fuimos de aquí para allá y tal vez debas hacer lo mismo.
englishTranslation: We went from here to there and maybe you must do the same.
vocabIncluded: "lo": "the" with no noun, as in "lo bueno"
de aquí para allá: from here to there (idiom)

spanishExample: He debido ir hacia atrás.
englishTranslation: I have had to(Deber participle) go backwards.
vocabIncluded: he: "have", "I have" before a participle (Haber, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Lo que dices no tiene nada que ver con las cosas que están en el cuarto.
englishTranslation: What you say has nothing to do with the things that are in the room.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
tener que ver: have to do (with) (idiom)

spanishExample: Lo que quieres está por allí, ahí atrás.
englishTranslation: What you want is over there, back there.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
atrás: back/backwards (adverb often used with de)

spanishExample: Mis amigos debieron haber hablado con todos ahí.
englishTranslation: My friends must have(Deber preterite plus haber) talked to everyone there.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
debieron: had to/must have, they had to/must have (Deber, preterite, 3rd person plural)
haber: "to have", "having" before a participle (Haber, infinitive)

spanishExample: No habla de deber hacer eso.
englishTranslation: He doesn’t talk about having to(Deber) do that.
vocabIncluded: de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
habla: speaks, he/she/it speaks (Hablar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Podemos ir a cualquier lado, tal vez a ese hotel.
englishTranslation: We can go anywhere, perhaps to that hotel.

spanishExample: Puede que debamos pasar por su casa.
englishTranslation: It might be that we must pass by his house.
vocabIncluded: debamos: must, we must (Deber, subjunctive, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Puede que yo deba ir.
englishTranslation: It might be that I must go.
vocabIncluded: deba: must, I must (Deber, subjunctive, 1st person)

spanishExample: Puedes hacerlo en otra parte, no tiene que ver con eso.
englishTranslation: You can do it in another place, it doesn’t have to do with that.
vocabIncluded: tener que ver: have to do (with) (idiom)

spanishExample: Sé que está lejos de aquí, pero adelante de su casa.
englishTranslation: I know it’s far from here, but in front of his house.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
adelante: in front (adverb often used with de)
lejos: far (adverb often used with de)

spanishExample: Tal vez ella no deba hacerlo, pero tú deberías ir.
englishTranslation: Perhaps she doesn’t have to(Deber) do it, but you should go.
vocabIncluded: deba: must, he/she/it must (Deber, subjunctive, 3rd person)
deberías: should, you should (Deber, conditional, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Tienes que ir abajo porque quieren hablar contigo.
englishTranslation: You have to go downstairs because they want to talk to you.
vocabIncluded: hablar: to speak / to talk (Hablar infinitive)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Todo el mundo estaba en la fiesta, pero ellos estaban arriba.
englishTranslation: Everybody was at the party, but they were upstairs.
vocabIncluded: arriba: up/upwards (adverb often used with de)

spanishExample: Ven para acá, cerca de la puerta para que te pueda ver.
englishTranslation: Come over here, near the door so that I can see you.
vocabIncluded: cerca: near (adverb often used with de)
para acá: over here/in this direction (idiom)
pueda: "be able", "I be able" (Poder, subjunctive, 1st person)
